column1: Minas de Matahambre (Spanish pronunciation: [minas ðe mataˈambɾe]) is a municipality and town in the Pinar del Río Province of Cuba. It was declared a National Monument of Cuba.
The municipality faces the Gulf of Mexico to the north
column2: where the cays of the Colorados Archipelago are developed off-shore. It is bordered by the municipalities of Mantua
column4: San Juan y Martínez and Viñales.

column1: The municipality includes the villages of Baja

column2: the municipality of Minas de Matahambre had a population of 34
column3: 419. With a total area of 858 km2 (331 sq mi)
column4: it has a population density of 40.1/km2 (104/sq mi).

column1: The Minas de Matahambre Municipal Museum holds objects and photography collections of local history.
